fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-16779].
  {panel}

It will be good if Confluence.home properties supports Windows UNC notation to specify location. The reason is because if Confluence wiki runs as a service, then it is unable to perform any automatic drive mapping. Drive mapping only occurs when a user performs a login. UNC can be convenience in the following places:
# Specifying the Confluence data directory: \\MYSERVER\Confluence_share\data
# Specifying the backup location: \\MYSERVER\Confluence_share\backups Specifying the attachment location.

All this would be useful because it can be installed on a local server and the data files can then reside on a mounted file system that is NOT local (i.e. CFIS file system).
fields.summary: Support UNC names in confluence.home properties instead of a drive letter

fields.description:
*Background*

If we have a '101' guide for a particular Atlassian product, then we probably don't require one for its Enterprise Hosted equivalent, because for all intents and purposes, its content would be essentially the same (save the installation sections).

However, due to link points from within the Sherpa Plugin, we need to have a 'Confluence Hosted 101' document that cuts out the 'installation' and some customisation sections from the Confluence 101 guide.

To do this, the common sections from the both 'Confluence 101' and 'Confluence Hosted 101' documents will be extracted into an inclusion library in the Confluence DOC space on CAC and the 'Confluence 101' and 'Confluence Hosted 101' guides will include their content.

Note that the 'Confluence Hosted 101' document's home will be placed in the EHOSTING space on CAC and will include common content from the DOC space.

Now for clarification on some confusing product naming:

'*Confluence Hosted for Small Business*' (formerly known as 'Confluence Team Hosted') is no longer available to new customers and will be terminated at the end of October 2009.

The new name for 'Confluence Enterprise Hosting' is '*Confluence Hosted*'. Existing customers with 'Confluence Hosted for Small Business' accounts will be migrated to this service (free of charge).

*Documentation work*

The new inclusion library pages (all in the DOC space)  are:
* [_Confluence and Confluence Hosted 101 Inclusions|http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DOC/_Confluence+and+Confluence+Hosted+101+Inclusions]
** [_Getting Started - Adding Users|http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DOC/_Getting+Started+-+Adding+Users]
** [_Customising Confluence - Adding Your Own Logo|http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DOC/_Customising+Confluence+-+Adding+Your+Own+Logo]
** [_Customising Confluence - Changing Confluence's Colours|http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DOC/_Customising+Confluence+-+Changing+Confluence%27s+Colours]
** [_Customising Confluence - Choosing a Different 'Theme'|http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DOC/_Customising+Confluence+-+Choosing+a+Different+%27Theme%27]
** [_Customising Confluence - Installing Plugins|http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DOC/_Customising+Confluence+-+Installing+Plugins]
** [_Customising Confluence - Using a Page Template|http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DOC/_Customising+Confluence+-+Using+a+Page+Template]
** [_Mastering the Basics - Creating Spaces, Pages and Blog Posts|http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DOC/_Mastering+the+Basics+-+Creating+Spaces%2C+Pages+and+Blog+Posts]
** [_Mastering the Basics - Searching Confluence|http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DOC/_Mastering+the+Basics+-+Searching+Confluence]
** [_Mastering the Basics - Subscribing to Updates|http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DOC/_Mastering+the+Basics+-+Subscribing+to+Updates]

(/) All of these pages are now published.(/)

The new 'containers' for these guides (i.e. which will incorporate the common inclusions) are:
* [Confluence 101 - copy|http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DOC/Confluence+101+-+copy] (in the DOC space)
(/) Contents of this temporary child page have been copied to parent and child page deleted.
* [Confluence Hosted 101|http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/EHOSTING/Confluence+Hosted+101] (in the EHOSTING space)
(/) Reviewed by Matt Hodges and implemented review changes.
(/) Now published.
fields.summary: Create a Confluence Hosted 101 guide.

This task brings in some parts of his work, in particular -

* Selenium Tests
* A refactoring of the 'Quick Nav' stuff to make is more usable in this context.

fields.description: The PropertiesManagerFactory loads the system properties first then overrides them with properties loaded from the configuration files.  This means properties set on the command line do not take precedence when they should,  it means you can't pass in properties from the build server (like bamboo passing in a known http port to use).

fields.description:
When migrating from Confluence 2.5 to 3.0, the attachment structure migration task fails if there are custom space logos present.

*To reproduce:*

# Create a Confluence 2.5 instance, and upload a custom space logo (and possibly at least one other attachment.)
# Replace Confluence 2.5 with 3.0.
# New attachments (in the Confluence 3.0 format) are created by the system for the space logos.
# The migration of the attachments tree to the new format fails because the 'ver003' directory exists.


*Workaround (for UNIX-like environments):*

After the above failure case, shut down Confluence and run the following sh command in the attachments directory to de-migrate space logos; the migration will then run properly:
{noformat}
$ for i in ver003/*/*/*/*/*/*; do mv $i .; done
$ rm -rf ver003
{noformat}

(I don't know when the change from space logos being special to being attachments happened.  This issue should affect any upgrades from older versions than that to current Confluence releases.)
fields.summary: Upgrade from Confluence 2.5 to 3.0 attachment migration fails if custom space logos present

download is here: http://www.firebirdsql.org/index.php?op=files&id=jaybird

Also, these instructions

driverClassName="org.firebirdsql.jdbc.FBDriver"
url="jdbc:firebirdsql:localhost/3050:/opt/firebird/examples/jiradb.fdb?autoReconnect=true"
[ delete the minEvictableIdleTimeMillis and
timeBetweenEvictionRunsMillis params here ]

specify a linux path.

If someone could take a look and update the doc to spec, that would be great.

Thanks in advance.

[Email Source|https://extranet.atlassian.com/display/PS/Helpspot+Issue+Display?run_1=&run_1_issueID=132578]

fields.description:
When editing a page via XML-RPC using Apache java client, once the size of the page gets a certain size, I get an error on the client side of 
{noformat}
org.xml.sax.SAXParseException: Premature end of file.
	at com.sun.org.apache.xerces.internal.parsers.AbstractSAXParser.parse(AbstractSAXParser.java:1231)
{noformat}

Size 6450 characters is OK.
Size 7525 characters is broken.

When I worked with Anatoli to try to replicate this, and I ran against confluence running on his dev box without SSL or an apache front-end, this worked for me.
fields.summary: Unable to edit a page on EAC via XML-RPC when the content is over a certain size.

fields.description:
When building confluence from sources, the build completes successfully, but confluence fails to start due to missing definition of the {{cacheManager}} bean in the spring config files.

There are many references to cacheManager bean which in previous versions was defined in {{cacheServiceContext.xml}} but that file now doesn't contain the definition any more.

This makes the current source bundle unusable for standalone or clustered development.
fields.summary: Source code bundle doesn't define cacheManager spring bean

fields.description:
I keep trying to educate users to do correct wiki linking but have concluded it is impossible -- fighting against the standard practice of copying and pasting URLs from the address bar is just too hard. Users are constantly creating external links which are really links back to another page in the wiki itself.

It would be best if Confluence would automatically change links back to its own server into standard wiki links so that links of the form:
[https://wikiserver.bigcompany.com/display/bigproject/Top+News]
[https://wikiserver.bigcompany.com/x/9tQ]
[https://wikiserver.bigcompany.com/pages/viewpage.action?pageId=197007158]
would all become:
[bigproject:Top News]

This should not be that hard to do upon saving the page and would automatically create a much sturdier wiki structure less prone to breakage when pages are moved/renamed. So this is a feature request and would be a HUGE win for all users -- particularly average ones.  Good software adapts to what the user does naturally.
fields.summary: External links that are really internal links should become syntactically correct internal wiki links automatically

fields.description:
Confluence treats NEWS/blogpost as a page after flushing the cache. Below is the step on how to reproduce the problem:
1) login into confluence
2) open and try editing any existing blogpost
3) click preview to create a draft
4) open administration\cache statistics and flush all caches
5) in user menu go to drafts
6) resume editing from the blogpost which draft we created on the second step
7) blogpost would be opened for edit as a page; it would have page specific input fileds such as location, restrictions
8) Save the page, you will get a *Page Not Found* page
9) If you go to the dashboard, you will see that the news is listed as Page.
fields.summary: Draft of NEWS/blogpost will be treated as page after flushing the cache

fields.description:
While using a debugger in Confluence (the use of the debugger is probably what exposed an unlikely race condition), I found that DefaultPersonalInformationManager.getOrCreatePersonalInformation() is not atomic as its comment claims, probably because there's no synchronisation on it.  The result was two user information objects created, with the user appearing twice in the people directory and the following error in the logs:

{noformat}
2009-08-27 15:04:24,630 ERROR [http-1990-Processor14] [com.atlassian.hibernate.HibernateObjectDao] findSingleObject 
Uh oh - found more than one object when single object requested: [userinfo: three v.1 (2064387), userinfo: three v.1 (2064388)]
 -- referer: http://localhost:1990/wiki/browsepeople.action?startIndex=0 | 
url: /wiki/display/~three | userName: testadmin | action: viewuserprofile
{noformat}

This issue may cause future problems in Studio, which has subscriptions from Crowd to notify it when new users are created, and uses the createPersonalInformation() method to put that user in the people directory.  I have no idea how this was called concurrently a second time by a different thread (maybe by the indexer in the background before the transaction was committed?) but what is certain is that there ended up being two personal information objects.
fields.summary: Duplicate user information objects created

fields.description:
Exported a page to PDF which consists of Russian character and English character, results all the Russian character is will be lost. For more information please view the attachment:

[Ataachment|^russian-425992-111554-10.pdf]

+Steps to reproduce+

# Copy the following wiki markup and paste it over to a page:
{code}
Виртуализация

Виртуализация — это технология позволяющая запускать несколько копий различных ОС на одном компьютере одновременно.

Наша система виртуализации построена на продукте Vmware vSphere — мировом лидере в сегменте систем виртуализации уровня предприятия.
Список терминов

    * Гипервизор — программа или аппаратная схема, обеспечивающая или позволяющая одновременное, параллельное выполнение нескольких или многих операционных систем на одном и том же сервере внутри виртуальных машин. Гипервизор также обеспечивает изоляцию операционных систем друг от друга, защиту и безопасность, разделение ресурсов между различными запущенными ОС и управление ресурсами. Гипервизор сам по себе в некотором роде является минимальной операционной системой (микроядром или наноядром).
    * Виртуальная машина(VM) — это программа эмулирующая реальный компьютер. Внутри VM устанавливают и запускают различные ОС, как буд-то на настоящем железе.
    * Гостевая ОС — это ОС запущенная в VM.
    * Нода ESX — это один из высокопроизводительных серверов, на который установлен гипервизор.
    * vCenter Server (VC) — Это ПО для управления нодами ESX «единой точки обзора».
    * DAS — Это подключённое через оптоволокно система хранения данных(СХД).

Создание VM
Политика наименования

У каждой VM должно быть имя, которое позволяет понять её назначение. К примеру:

wmng-dev-01

В случае когда такое имя создать невозможно, то необходимо обязательно описать её назначение в графе Annotations находящийся в вкладке Summary. К примеру:
{code}
# Save the changes 
# Export the page to PDF

+Extra information+

# Tested with the [Russian language pack|http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DISC/Language+Pack+Translations] and set the site to use Russian language, but the problem still reproducible.
# This is not reproducible when the page is exported to word document.
fields.summary: Exported PDF do not contained Russian letters.

fields.description: Confluence does not prevent someone from making a script that tries every possible password combination for a Confluence account.  There should be an option to set a max attempts and then lock out the user from the system.  This is obviously a security problem as Confluence within most companies uses LDAP to authenticate and if user's LDAP's are breached then many other applications are breached.
fields.summary: Add a password lockout feature

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-16723].
  {panel}

Hello,

whenever one customizes Layouts the definition will permanently override the one that ships with Confluence so any change carried over with newer versions will not be applied (possibly breaking existing features).

It would be convenient to notify the Administrator performing the upgrade of this condition and improve the Layout editor by providing a diff view of the changes (and possibly an option to merge or ignore the changes or revert to original)


Best Regards,
Edoardo
fields.summary: Diff viewer for Custom Layout definitions (and merge editor?)

fields.description:
According to the Confluence [documentation|http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DOC/Disabling%20the%20Built-In%20User%20Management], when you enable External User Management, "...assignment of permissions to groups and users is still carried out within Confluence, but the creation of groups and users is not."  The last bit is incorrect and has been since Confluence 2.9.3.

In Confluence 2.10 and up, while External User Management is enabled you can still create local users and groups.  In Confluence 2.9.3, the option to add new users/groups is greyed out when External User Management is enabled.

In Confluence 3.5, the option is still confusingly broken, and the new user directories configuration adds additional complexity. The option should be removed and Confluence should be smart enough to display only options in the UI that make sense. For example, if there are no read-write directories enabled, then public sign-up and adding a user should be prevented or disabled.
fields.summary: External User Management option is confusing, does not work properly and should be removed

fields.description:
After renaming a BlogPost, pageManager.getById() starts to return a Page, not a BlogPost.  

It only seems to happen when inside an Action.  Inside a Macro, it works fine, it returns a BlogPost.  

And it only seems to happen after the BlogPost is renamed.  Before renaming it, it works fine, it returns a BlogPost.  After the renaming, it returns a Page.

Before:

url of blogpost 'blogpost: demo page v.1 (13598761)'=/display/test/2009/08/23/demo+page

After:

url of page 'page: demo page - renamed v.2 (13598761)'=/display/test/demo+p
age+-+renamed

fields.description:
At the moment, when clicking on an external link in the help tips box it takes you away from your current context. As these links usually take you to documentation screens, which aim to assist you with your current task (screen) and are effectively used simultaneously with the current screen, this is bad behaviour. This is the same reasoning that caused us to change it in the Macro Browser - which came from user tests.

Brian and I will discuss cases where you aren't taken to documentation and determine if it is appropriate to open these cases in a new tab or window.
fields.summary: Help Tips - external links open in new tab/window

fields.description:
An administrator can disable many of the macros in Confluence, but some of them are used by Confluence for functionality which is not supposed to be disabled. Some examples are:

- recently updated, used on the dashboard and default space content
- page tree search, used in default space content
- network, used in the personal space sidebar
- follow, used in user hover
- profile, used in the people directory
- page tree, used in Browse > Pages, edit page.

Unless the associated functionality is disabled completely (e.g. to address CONF-16032), administrators should not be able to disable these macros.
fields.summary: Prevent administrators disabling macro plugins which are part of core application functionality

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-16682].
  {panel}

Why are there both 'Plugins' and 'Plugin Repository'? That confused me when I started using Confluence. As far as I can see there are two things that 'Plugins' does that 'Plugin Repository' doesn't:
~ It shows individual modules - this could be added to the plugin repository
~ It's fast to load. This should be fixed in the plugin repository; maybe with an 'Installed Plugins' as the first tab, and an 'Available Plugins' as the 2nd (IDEA style)
If we did this we could drop the 'Plugins' part. (Yes I'm aware that 'Plugin Repository' is itself a plugin, but I don't think that should matter.)
fields.summary: Remove 'Plugins' Admin Link

{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-16668].
  {panel}

aka {{Confluence for Recruitment processes}} 

- that helps to find out, which skills each employee has and lets me identify the experts in difference knowledge domains within my company

 *there isn't a plugin specifically designed to allows for the Skill management.*

However, one could use techniques of creating specific labels that would describe one's skills under a profile or as a separate page for each employee. 
That was you could use a label macro to fetch all skills you are after and links to user's pages where more information is collated. (Confluence for recruitment :)

http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DOC/Working+with+Labels+Overview
http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DOC/Label+Macros

http://forums.atlassian.com/thread.jspa?threadID=36448&tstart=30

fields.description:
Application is set fully in UTF-8 (DB, Apache, Confluence)

With version 2.8, when clicking on a link from Word (XP), the confluence page was displayed correctly with UTF-8 as encoding.
However with version 3.0, the page is displayed in shift-JIS as default (I am in Japan), meaning all characters are garbled.
IE 6 is set to detect correct encoding.
Any idea to solve this small problem?

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-16663].
  {panel}

I have some troubles with the integration between google analytics and confluence. I would like to track which user has visited the site (internal use). So far I have this code:

{noformat}
#if ($userAccessor.hasMembership("groupA", $action.remoteUser.name))
  #set ($usertype= 'userA')
#else
  #set ($usertype= 'userB')
#end

<script type="text/javascript">pageTracker._setVar('$usertype: $action.remoteUser');</script>
{noformat} 

This one works *only* if the user is within groupA. In that case it is logged into google analytics as "userA". However, if the user is within any other group I don't get his info logged, I would expect to get "userB" in this case

Any leads on this one?

Thanks

Programatically speaking, when invoking such methods as: 

{{AttachmentDataDao.saveDataForAttachment(Attachment attachment, InputStream data)}}

If there are fewer bytes in the data stream than specified in the file size of the attachment, then we should: 

# ensure clients are notified appropriately
# roll back the saving of the attachment (and the associated attachment data)

This could happen if an upload is cancelled and only a portion of the file is transferred and hence readable via the stream.
fields.summary: When saving attachment data Confluence should indicate if the data provided is incomplete

fields.description:
Further to CONF-16652 if you redo the search in the Insert Link dialog to try to return the page you want in the first page of results (because you can't look beyond page 1) and the page does come up the list, then:
1. click the page name
-> page name is entered into the Link field
2. click the Ok button
-> nothing happens: the link is not created in the page you were editing, nor is the dialog closed.

To successfully create the link you have to close and reopen the dialog box.
fields.summary: "Insert Link" dialog box doesn't insert a link if you've tried to access page 2 or later of search results

fields.description:
1. In Wiki markup mode, select some text to be made into a link and click the insert link icon.
2. In the "Insert Link" dialog enter some text in the search field and click search. Aim to have multiple pages of results.

If the page you want to link is *not* on the first page of search results, click page number 2 to see if it's there. The dialog flickers as if it's refreshing, but you are still on page 1 of the search results. Click the "Next>>" button to try to proceed to another page. Same outcome.

I can't seem to get past page 1 of the search results in the Insert Link dialog.

FYI the URL for search result page number 6 (for example) is:
{code}http://tsb-km01:8181/confluence/users/insertlink.action?currentspace=~sextond&amp;formname=%24req.getParameter%28%27formname%27%29&amp;fieldname=&amp;draftType=&amp;spaceKey=~sextond&mode=search&startIndex=50{code}
but it doesn't change the display from page 1.

The Index was rebuilt (through Confluence Admin) just before running this test.
fields.summary: "Insert Link" dialog box search doesn't let you go to page 2 or later of search results
XSS vulnerability can be exploited with the pagetree macro
JIRA Issue state changes create updated Status in Confleunce

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-16649].
  {panel}

We are a very large organization, using many live-templates (Scaffolding). We are passing meta-data values to other pages. However, when running a metadata-report, it shows all results with a particular label (or specificy MaxRestults=30). Suppose we have 3000 pages total that we are calling, and we only show 30 in the report, then it will show 30, and nobody will know the other 2970 even exist.

So if you look at the contentbylabel macro, it says "Showing 1-30 out of 3000", so you know the other 3000 exist. 

To take it one step further, it would be spectacular if it were possible to get this message on meta-data report AND get some arrows for pagination, so it keep me on the same screen and using Ajax (or something similar) allow us to click arrows to see the next 30 results. Similar to the jira-issues macro.

Good USE CASE: Teams at a company want to use Scaffolding and Metadata for project or action tracking. At the end of those projects or actions, they ddon't want them to populate in the table anymore (because they are old), but they don't want to delete them either. They all want an archive of everything they do for future reference. Like many company's the users don't have great adoption with utilizing the labels (nor the knowledge of how the macros interact with the labels), so it's not a simple fix of the end users changing the labels. Hence the need for pagination.
fields.summary: pagenation for metadata-report

fields.description: I upgraded our Confluence from 2.9.1 to 3.0.0_01 today. The {pagetree}-macro throws java.lang.ClassNotFoundException: com.atlassian.confluence.renderer.WikiStyleRenderer. I skimmed through WEB-INF/lib and found that atlassian-renderer-5.0-beta9.jar has WikiStyleRenderer in package com.atlassian.renderer.
fields.summary: pagetree-macro throws ClassNotFoundException

fields.description:
See the attached image.
A thumbnail is not being generated in 3.0 anymore while still perfectly does in 2.7.3
3.0 renders an error message about image format not being supported

java -cp atlassian-core-4.3-beta1.jar com.atlassian.core.util.ImageInfo returns image/pjpeg as a mime type.

For other images that are identified by ImageInfo as image/jpeg (without the "p") thumbnails work.
fields.summary: Thumbnails not working in 3.0 for the same JPEG file as still does in 2.7.3
